page.title: 20The Richmond-Brompton Road.
page.content: {Brompton-on-Swale Caravan Park}is two kilometres from{Richmond}.Visitors can fish in the{River Swale}and children can play safely in the shallow stretch of river which runs through the park. The disused railway line, ideal for walking on,runs from the site towards {Easby Abbey}.Caravans,motor-caravans and tents are all welcome.There are caravans for hire and static holiday homes for sale.The site is equipped with a telephone box,a well-stocked shop,children's play area and TV room. Dogs are welcome.The Caravan Park is an ideal touring base for{Swaledale.} {St.Trinian's},once a sand and gravel quarry 1 km from{Richmond},is now a centre for car-sales,a base for an agricultural food firm and an authorised tipping place for a local builder.Part of{St.Trinian's Hall}is now an Antique Dealers.
